title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (https://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: considering pull request, may want open issue first discuss maintainer(s).

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Fork repo GitHub account Clone version account machine account, e.g,. git clone https://github.com/<yourgithubusername>/rdryad.git Make sure track progress upstream (.e., version rdryad ropensci/rdryad) git remote add upstream https://github.com/ropensci/rdryad.git. making changes make sure pull changes upstream either git fetch upstream merge later git pull upstream fetch merge one step Make changes (bonus points making changes new feature branch - see https://guides.github.com/introduction/flow/ contribute branching, making changes, submitting pull request) Push account Submit pull request home base (likely master branch, check make sure) ropensci/rdryad

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Check discussion forum think issue requires longer form discussion.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Karthik Ram. Author. Scott Chamberlain. Author, maintainer. Carl Boettiger. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ram K, Chamberlain S, Boettiger C (2024). rdryad: Access Dryad Web Services. R package version 1.0.1.95, https://github.com/ropensci/rdryad, https://docs.ropensci.org/rdryad.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rdryad: Access for Dryad Web Services},   author = {Karthik Ram and Scott Chamberlain and Carl Boettiger},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.1.95, https://github.com/ropensci/rdryad},   url = {https://docs.ropensci.org/rdryad}, }

title: Access for Dryad Web Services
text: * rdryad package interface Dryad data repository. _*package superceded {deposits}. See Issue #39_ General Dryad API documentation: https://datadryad.org/api/v2/docs/ rdryad docs: https://docs.ropensci.org/rdryad/

title: Access for Dryad Web Services
text: Please report issues bugs. License: MIT Get citation information rdryad R citation(package = 'rdryad') Please note project released Contributor Code Conduct. participating project agree abide terms.

Get datasets by DOI(s) — dryad_dataset
text: dois (character) one DOIs, required ... args passed crul::verb-GET

title: Get datasets by DOI(s) — dryad_dataset
code: if (FALSE) { dryad_dataset(doi = "10.5061/dryad.f385721n") dois <- c("10.5061/dryad.f385721n", "10.5061/dryad.7ct1n", "10.5061/dryad.1g626") dryad_dataset(dois = dois) }

Get dataset versions by DOI(s) — dryad_dataset_versions
code: if (FALSE) { x = dryad_dataset_versions(dois = "10.5061/dryad.f385721n") x dois <- c("10.5061/dryad.f385721n", "10.5061/dryad.7ct1n", "10.5061/dryad.1g626") dryad_dataset_versions(dois = dois) }

title: List datasets — dryad_datasets
text: ... Named key-value sequeunce parameters passed Dryad query "page" (nunber), "per_page".

title: List datasets — dryad_datasets
code: if (FALSE) { (x <- dryad_datasets()) x$meta x$links x$data x <- dryad_datasets(per_page = 50, page = 7) }

title: dryad_download — dryad_download

Defunct OAI-PMH functions — oai-defunct
text: Defunct OAI-PMH functions Download metadata individual Dryad id's Learn Dryad OAI-PMH service. List Dryad records Gets OAI Dryad identifiers Get available Dryad metadata formats List sets Dryad metadata repository.

title: Defunct OAI-PMH functions — oai-defunct
code: dr_get_records(...)  dr_identify(...)  dr_list_records(   prefix = "oai_dc",   from = NULL,   until = NULL,   set = "hdl_10255_3",   token = NULL,   as = "df",   ... )  dr_list_identifiers(   prefix = "oai_dc",   from = NULL,   until = NULL,   set = "hdl_10255_3",   token = NULL,   as = "df",   ... )  dr_list_metadata_formats(...)  dr_list_sets(token = NULL, as = "df", ...)

title: Defunct OAI-PMH functions — oai-defunct
text: Dryad OAI-PMH service longer updated See http://wiki.datadryad.org/Old:Dryad_API#OAI-PMH Defunct functions: dr_get_records dr_identify dr_list_records dr_list_identifiers dr_list_metadata_formats dr_list_sets

what: Interface to the Dryad Web services — rdryad-package
title: Interface to the Dryad Web services — rdryad-package
text: Includes access Dryad's Solr API, OAI-PMH service, part REST API.

title: Interface to the Dryad Web services — rdryad-package
text: functions match three major sets Dryad API routes datasets, fiiles versions. Datasets: dryad_dataset() dryad_datasets() dryad_dataset_versions() Files: dryad_files() dryad_files_download() Versions: dryad_versions() dryad_versions_files() dryad_versions_download()

title: Interface to the Dryad Web services — rdryad-package
text: Dryad Solr API longer updated, functions used work defunct, see solr-defunct Dryad OAI-PMH service longer updated, functions used work defunct, see oai-defunct defunct functions: dryad_metadata() dryad_package_dois() handle2doi() doi2handle() dryad_files() dryad_fetch() - use instead dryad_files_download() dryad_versions_download()

title: Defunct Solr functions — solr-defunct
text: Dryad Solr service longer updated See http://wiki.datadryad.org/Old:Dryad_API#SOLR_search_access Defunct functions: d_solr_search d_solr_facet d_solr_group d_solr_highlight d_solr_mlt d_solr_stats

title: Get a dataset version by version ID — versions
rdryad 1.0.0
text: Package redone work new Dryad API v2. functions defunct, ’s three sets new functions following three major sets API routes datasets, versions, files. See ?rdryad (#28) (#29)

title: rdryad 0.4.0
text: gains new function dryad_metadata() download Dryad file metadata gains new function dryad_package_dois() get file DOIs Dryad package DOI (package can many files) (#22)

title: rdryad 0.4.0
text: dryad_files (formerly download_url()) now scrapes Dryad page get URLs Dryad files instead using API, dependable (#26) dryad_fetch gains parameter try_file_names (boolean) TRUE try extract file names URLs (#26)

title: rdryad 0.4.0
text: fix solr rdryad functions hard code use xml return format, followlocation follow redirects (#27)

title: rdryad 0.4.0
text: two new pacakage dependencies: tibble data.table

title: rdryad 0.3.0
text: Move using solrium package instead solr package interaction Dryad’s Solr backend (#21) (#24) Now using crul instead httr HTTP requests (#23) gains two new functions handle2doi doi2handle convert handles DOIs, DOIs handles, respectively (#25) download_url function name changed dryad_files, can still use download_url next version. addition, download_url/dryad_files parameters id changed doi.

title: rdryad 0.3.0
text: dryad_fetch improved, uses curl::curl_download instead download.file. now accepts >1 input URL, destile length must equal number urls.

title: rdryad 0.2.0
text: Re-worked package. New package API, methods , many different. (#16) New functions (see functions starting d_*()) interact Dryad Solr search engine (#10) OAI-PMH functions now using internally oai package. (#14)

title: rdryad 0.2.0
text: Slimmed dependencies smaller set. Changed license CC0 MIT (#17) Added tests (#18) Changed function get files download , attempt read R, introduces long dependency chain (#15)
